fields.description:
h3. Description
The what's new button in the [Portfolio for JIRA Home|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver] is not working. The button will not redirect the user to another page when is clicked.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Go to this link: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/#
# Click the View the latest changes button in the *What's new* section
fields.summary: What's new button is not working in Portfolio for JIRA Home documentaiton

fields.description:
h5. Feature Summary

Currently, when we are trying to test out what provides specific functionalities in JIRA, it usually involves us having to enabling and disabling various modules to determine which module provides the functionality in JIRA.

Would it be possible to have an *internal document* listing what each module does which support can refer to when they need to troubleshoot an issue in JIRA?

This would greatly help us reduce the time spent troubleshooting issues as we can use this to rule out possible causes.
fields.summary: Documentation for Modules Usability

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian Team,

we are looking for a possibility to create a Project role that can be assigned to issues or report issues, but that has not the possibility to browse all issues in the project. We found a solution setting a security level to every single issue in the project, but honestly that is not really comfortable and much more error-prone than a special project role would be.

Please tell me if there already is a solution for this case, but I think we need a new permission in the scheme for that.

Thanks a lot!

Jan
fields.summary: Ability to Create a Project Role that only views their reported and assigned issues

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user access the dashboard of a JIRA instance that was originally installed in a different language than English, if they view the wallboard, all system provided text would be in the language JIRA was originally installed in rather than the current JIRA Server language or the User preferred language.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA Software and during the original setup when prompted, select German as your language.
# Once JIRA is installed, create a sample Board with data in it.
# Change the JIRA language to English and Change the User preferred language to English.
# Create a dashboard.
# Add the Sprint Health Gadget to the Dashboard (Confirmed to affect other Software Provided Gadgets like Sprint History).
#- Have the gadget show data for the sprint board from step 2.
# Click the {{....}} and select View Wallboard.

h5. Expected behavior 

JIRA would show the Gadget and it's contents in English which is the current language JIRA is running on and which is what it shows when you view the dashboard.

h5. Actual Result

JIRA would show the gadget in German which was the original JIRA was installed on with only values like the name of the gadget which the user entered appearing in English as seen below:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Wallboard Language Different from Server and User Preference Language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an existing issue is being edited, such as summary has changed, activity stream is still showing the old summary unless the filter _Issue Edited_ is included in the activity stream gadget configuration.

h3. Environment
JIRA Server 7.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable activity stream gadget in your dashboard
# Create an issue
# Activity stream is showing the new issue has been created with the current summary
# When you edit this issue to a new summary
# Activity stream is still showing the previous summary

h3. Expected Results
It should reflect the latest summary of the edited issue

h3. Actual Results
It is still showing the previous summary of the edited issue
 
h3. Notes
When you configure the activity stream gadget, add Activity > Issue Edited event, then the activity stream feed will show the issue is being edited to the new summary of the edited issue
fields.summary: activity stream does not show the latest updated summary of an issue

From Sean Au:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/configuring-the-user-default-settings-861253161.html] is the documentation about User Default Settings. One of the settings is named "Default Access" with two c's.

In JIRA 7.3.5 User Profile, the same setting has a typo in its name - Acccess with three c's

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Link to issue list in Issue Navigator breaks if the release has a name that contains a plus sign (+)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a version with a name that has a plus sign eg: "1.20.1+x".
# Set issues to the release
# Go to the release page of the project and hover over the progress bar of that created version. Here you will get information of how many issues are in that release and this number should be clickable
# Click on the number

h3. Expected Results
Should open the issue navigator showing all the issues in that version

h3. Actual Results
Opens the issue navigator, however, the plus sign is removed from the versions name and so you get the error:
bq. The value '1.20.1 x' does not exist for the field 'fixVersion'.

h3.Workaround
When you get the above error in the issue navigator, add back the plus sign and you should be able to check the issues in the release
fields.summary: Link to issue list in Issue Navigator breaks if the release has a name that contains a plus sign (+)

fields.description:
h3. Definition
In cases where projects were restricted between internal staffs and different customers, it is somehow considered as a security issue when Customer A (restricted to Project A) can see the users in Customer B (restricted to Project B). It should not show the users on the Assignee field because in the first place, these users don't have access to the project. It may also cause some problem if the ticket has been accidentally assigned to someone who doesn't have a permission to view the issue. 

h3. Suggestion
Be able to restrict or limit the list of users showing up on the Assignee field or any user picker field based on Browse Project permissions.

h3. Workaround

As for the Assignee field, we can manage the list of applicable users for respective project via Project settings >> Assignable User permission. For example, you can define a certain user or user group and the list will be populated with the preferred users accordingly.
fields.summary: Restrict the Users showing up on the Assignee Field based on Browse Project permissions

fields.description: This is the smallest of issues, but enough to be frustrating. It would be awesome if links in descriptions would open in a new tab. There are multiple times when I will click on a link and then when I am ready to go back to the task, I hit close on the tab I opened. But because links open in the same tab, that also closes JIRA.
fields.summary: Open links in new tab

fields.description:
Hi,

We have an internal Jira server used by internal employees of our company.

Now we want a solution such that external customers can interact with us on different internal projects but we don't want to give access to internal Jira server.

The requirement is that external customers should be able to view/update some of the projects/issue and not all. 

Another requirement is that there should be links between issues of different projects.

What could be the best solution in this scenerio?

One option is to create a completly different server for external customers but then question arises how SOME the internal projects and issues can be shared? Replicating same information is not an option.

I believe this problem is very generic and other people also face similar situation.

Is there a standard solution for this scenerio by Atlassian?

Can some of the data (projects/issues) can be projected some how to a different instance and both are synced?

Help is appreciated!

 

Regards,

Zeeshan
fields.summary: Jira for external customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem 
Sometimes JIRA's index is corrupted during shutdown. See: JRASERVER-61099
Now the only way to fix it is to delete the whole index and run foreground reindex, which makes JIRA inactive for the period of reindexing.

h3. Suggested Solution
Lucene already has a tool to check and fix corrupted index: [CheckIndex|https://lucene.apache.org/core/3_3_0/api/all/org/apache/lucene/index/CheckIndex.html#fixIndex(org.apache.lucene.index.CheckIndex.Status]
We can use this and fix index during startup. Obviously we'll lose some data, but at least JIRA will be operational.
fields.summary: Fix corrupted index during startup
Improve the response schema in our REST API documentation

fields.description:
h5. Experienced Behavior:
After creating a project the Default Issue Type Scheme is not automatically updated to include issue types created during project creation.
The Default Issue Type Scheme must include all issue types. These types not being included in the Default Issue Type Scheme causes errors when performing actions in JIRA

Related to ticket - [JRASERVER-59866|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59866]

h5.Suggestion request -
Provide an option to choose which issue type can be defined in the 'default issue type scheme' without the needs to go into database and having unnecessary downtime to our production server. You guys will just need to unlock the option to add/remove the issue type, similar to other normal issue type scheme.

To introduce the add/remove option to *default issue type scheme* just like the "copy" of the scheme allows to choose extra issue types under _Available Issue Types_ such as -
Bug
Task
Sub-tasks
fields.summary: Provide an option to defined issue types in the "Default Issue Type Scheme"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using Wiki Markup to render links with square brackets JIRA won't recognize it properly, so it won't render as a link.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket on JIRA
# Add a comment with a link in the following format: [Test|http://www.jraserver65650example.com#testing[test]-test]

h3. Expected Results

JIRA will recognize the format and render the word *Test* as a link

h3. Actual Results

JIRA will just display [Test|http://www.jraserver65650example.com#testing[test]-test] instead.

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Wiki Markup does not work with links with square brackets

fields.description:

Currently, we could only see the Summary, status and assignee of the subtask from the Subtasks section of an issue. Adding more fields can be globally configured in Advanced Settings {{jira.table.cols.subtasks}}. Based on project requirements, the fields visible on subtask section varies.

For example: comments that are restricted to a group called "internal" should not be included in the export

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the same username exist in multiple directories, when auto suggest/auto complete the users in issue navigator and assignee field, it will display duplicate username.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Server 7.4.1 and 7.3.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a username, example: _charlie_ in JIRA Internal
# Create the same username, _charlie_ in LDAP directory
# Sync the LDAP directory to JIRA
# Go to Issue Navigator, type assignee=charlie

Alternatively using 2 user directories.

# Create a username  charlie in an LDAP directory add it the user to 2 user groups: group A and group B
# Setup 2 user directories to one for  group A and another for group B


h3. Expected Results
There will be only one _charlie_ username display in the auto suggest/autocomplete

h3. Actual Results
Thera two _charlie_ user being display at the same time in the auto suggest/autocomplete
!bug1.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
This only appear in certain field such as issue navigator, assignee (inline in issue view) however assignee field in create/edit issue screen works fine

h3.Workaround
Avoid using duplicate username or manually deactivate the user in the database (set active=0)
fields.summary: duplicate users when auto suggest/autocomplete if the same username exist in multiple directories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When switching between issue types and using the *Configure Fields* button to customize the fields on the create screen, the existing configuration for fields is overridden if the issue type is changed and issue types are using unique screens that do not show the same fields.  Fields that are not present on the most recently chosen issue type will not be configured as visible when you switch back to other issue types even though they were previously configured to be.

h3. Environment
*  JIRA 7.3.6
*  Chrome 59.0.3071.115

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Scrum Project (TST)
# Edit the TST - Scrum Bug Screen to remove a field or two
# Go to a dashboard
# Click the *Create* button to open create dialog
# Choose the TST project and Story for the issue type
# Click *Configure fields* and choose custom
# Check all boxes so that all fields are enabled
# Change the issue type to Bug
# Click *Configure fields* and uncheck and then re-check one item
# Change the issue type to Story
# Click *Configure fields* and note which fields are now checked

h3. Expected Results
All fields should still be checked and visible on the create screen for the Story issue type

h3. Actual Results
Only fields that were present on both the screens configured for Story and Bug issue types are checked.  The fields removed earlier from the _TST - Scrum Bug Screen_ will not longer be checked when switching back to the Story issue type.

h3.Workaround

No workaround to prevent this behavior, however, it if is problematic to users, you could disable the *Configure fields* button as noted in JRASERVER-27707
fields.summary: "Configure Fields" configuration is overridden when switching issue types leading to missing fields

fields.description:
Currently when we change the card colors in Kanban boards, it just changes the color of a bar on the side of the cards.

 

It would be cool if we could configure it to change the color of the entire card, not just that little bar.
fields.summary: Ability to change color of entire card, not just a color bar

fields.description:
*As a UX Designer and Software Tester I'd like* to have the ability to configure the image transition effect in the JIRA lightbox when proceeding from one to the next still image to my liking, with one option to have no effect at all.

*In particular when having sequential screenshots which tell a story*, a flashing transformation effect makes it much harder to easily detect the changes from one image to the other, and therefore is of less functional value.

The lightbox in JIRA must *first provide functional value* (quick visual A/B comparison, quick skipping) *over an enriched multimedia experience* with 500ms-1000ms flashy transition animations.
fields.summary: Lightbox: Ability to configure image transition effect to none or at least less obtrusive

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Jira uses temp tables to perform some of its functions. When creating temp tables, SQL server uses the instance-level collation, and Jira currently does not specify collation on table creation. If the instance-level collation is different from the database-level collation, Jira and temp table collation will not match.
h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install SQL Server with a collation that is not supported (*SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI* and *Latin1_General_CI_AI* are supported)
 # Create a database with the correct collation (e.g. *SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI*)
 # Error shows in logs in reference to temp tables.

h2. Expected Results

Should report collation is correct "SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI"
h2. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2017-06-20 18:10:46,004 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-12 ERROR Scott.Lepech 1090x309x1 15yequj 10.7.35.65 /rest/projecttemplates/1.0/create-templates/item/35 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT user_name FROM dbo.cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name IN ( select item from #temp1 ) ) AND (directory_id = ? ) ORDER BY lower_user_name (Cannot resolve the collation conflict between "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS" and "SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI" in the equal to operation.)
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT user_name FROM dbo.cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name IN ( select item from #temp1 ) ) AND (directory_id = ? ) ORDER BY lower_user_name (Cannot resolve the collation conflict between "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS" and "SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI" in the equal to operation.)
{noformat}
h2. Workaround

Change the instance-level collation to match the Jira database collation to *SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI* or *Latin1_General_CI_AI*. You can use this guide to do so: [Set or Change the Server Collation|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/collations/set-or-change-the-server-collation?view=sql-server-2014].
fields.summary: Collation error in Jira when the database and server/default collation do not match in SQL Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clustered job may run on more than one node if execution time is longer then interval. 

For example:
* Job configured as interval job with 1 min interval, job is a 3-minute-thread-sleep. 
* Job will scheduled at node1
* And than 1 min later at node2 while still running on node1

h3. Environment
* JIRA datacenter  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Schedule the long interval Job (see above)
# Wait and monitor the jobs status 

h3. Expected Results
Only single job is executed across the cluster. 

h3. Actual Results
Two instances of the job will be running in the cluster. 

h3. Workaround 
Implement cluster lock at Job level.  See details:  [Plugin guide to jira high-availability and clustering|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/jira-data-center/plugin-guide-to-jira-high-availability-and-clustering]
fields.summary: Clustered job may run on more than one node if execution time is longer then interval.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-7238].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA Reports do not use the ISO8601 formatting for its date pickers.

h3. Environment
JIRA Core

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a JIRA instance with Agile/Software installed;
# Navigate to *Administration > System > Look and Feel* and set JIRA to use ISO8601 formatting for date pickers;
# Navigate to a Project > Reports
# Click on "Recently Created Issues Report" > Set period to "Weekly"
# Observe that the reports do not start on Mondays bit on Sunday (ignoring the ISO8601 standard)

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Reports should consistently use the ISO8601 setting if it has been configured in JIRA.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA Reposts does not apply this setting, as a result the weeks start on sunday


h3. Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: JIRA Reports do not respect JIRA's ISO8601 setting

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Upgrading JIRA with the installer and with the option to back up the Home directory enabled, the process may fail with error {{CreateZipFileAction}}. It could be caused by file permission as mentioned in [this Suggestion ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63068] or some corrupted files in the Home directory e.g. *attachments*.
* This can be verified by compressing the Home directory manually. If there are corrupted file(s), using {{tar}} command to compress the folder and the result would be 
{code}
tar: application-data/data/attachments/JRA/JRA-1234/56789: File shrank by 19573448400 bytes; padding with zeros
{code}
(i) This verification method is provided courtesy of [~vmunier1612780905]. Thanks Vincent!

h3. Suggestion
Better warning message or more details on the action failure

h3. Workaround
* Uncheck the auto backup option for Home directory
fields.summary: Better warning message in Installer when JIRA upgrade failed with error CreateZipFileAction

fields.description:
*Use Case:*

As a JIRA admin I would like to restore the XML backup from production into my test environment. I would like to keep certain elements from my staging instance rather than importing the production values. 
* If the production values are imported I must go and change them to back to the staging configuration. 

Examples of configuration that I would like to keep:
* Look and Feel
** Color scheme in staging
** Logo used in staging
* Announcement Banner
* Base URL
* License

The following are additional configuration items that could be retained:
* Application Link configuration
* User directory configuration
* Mail server configuration

*Suggested Change:*
On the restore screen provide checkboxes where the admin can select certain configuration elements they wish to keep.
fields.summary: Ability to retain staging instance configuration when importing XML from production

fields.description:

It would be a great if we could bulk remove inactive users from groups.

fields.description:
h4. Preconditions

* Install Confluence and JIRA.
* Access them via HTTP.
* Ensure that remote confluence issue links are retrieved via REST (this is the default behaviour in JIRA 7.3.x)

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Create an application link between Confluence and JIRA
# On an issue, create a Confluence page link to at least three pages. The more, the more likely this error will occur.
# Navigate to the global issue search page (e.g.,, {{http://yourjirainstance.com/issues/?jql=}})
# Put the issue navigator in to "details mode"
# Select the issue with the page links so that it loads in to the detail panel.
# Repeatedly render this issue in quick succession (e.g., use the {{j}} and {{k}} keyboard shortcuts to navigate away from and to the issue quickly)

h4. Expected results

Every confluence page link should render correctly.

h4. Actual results

Some of the requests for the rendered issue link will respond with an HTTP 500.

 !Screen Shot 2017-07-13 at 2.36.52 pm.png|thumbnail!  
[^localhost.har.zip] 

An error appears in the server logs: {noformat}
2017-07-13 22:18:03,648 http-nio-8090-exec-20 ERROR bob 1338x5557x2 1csbprt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/10002 [c.a.j.p.v.issuelink.rest.RemoteIssueLinkResource] Error occurred while generating final HTML for remote issue link: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: java.io.IOException: Failed to load Confluence Page from remote server Caused by: com.atlassian.applinks.internal.common.auth.oauth.OAuthMessageProblemException: OAuth authentication failed: nonce_used
{noformat}

h4. Notes

This seems to be a request timing problem, in which OAuth suspects the legitimate client requests to the remote instance are in fact replay attacks over an insecure HTTP connection.
fields.summary: Issue links fail to render with an OAuth nonce_used exception

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 11-22-2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}

This bug is related to the Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools plugin, and it is currently being tracked in the Ecosystem request [ATST-923|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ATST-923]. Please direct any feedback related to this bug to that request.

Best regards,
René Chiquete - Atlassian Support.
{panel}

h3. Summary

Health Check is returning an error when connecting JIRA 7.4.0 to Confluence 5.9.5 although the application link is working according to the 2 following points:
 - in JIRA Admin > Applications > Application Links, the status of the Application Link is "Connected"
 !JIRA_ApplicationLinkToConfluence5.9.5.png|thumbnail!

 - when trying to link a Confluence page to a JIRA issue from the Link dialog, the Confluence page is properly connected
 !LinkWithinIssueToConfluence5.9.5.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.4.0
 # Install Confluence 5.9.5
 # Create an Application link to Confluence from the JIRA UI
 # Go to JIRA Admin > System > Support Tools
 # Click on "Services" to expand it
 # Click on "Application Links" to expand it

h3. Expected Results

The result should be "Your application links are all working properly", as it's the case when linking JIRA to Confluence 6.3.1.

!HealthCheck_Confluence6.3.1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The result says "One of your application links is reporting "Network error".", although the application link is working and it is possible to link Confluence pages to JIRA issues:

!HealthCheck_Confluence5.9.5.png|thumbnail!

Also, when navigating to any other JIRA page, a pop-up shows at the top-right corner with a similar error:

!HealthCheckPopUp_Confluence5.9.5.png|thumbnail!

Lastly, we can see the following warning in the JIRA logs:
{code:java}
2017-07-13 12:25:16,020 HealthCheck:thread-6 WARN      [c.a.applinks.core.DefaultApplinkStatusService] Unrecognized error while attempting to retrieve status of Application Link 'df6813a6-ecd0-3c00-8c59-1673445a2fc4'
{code}
h3. +NOTE+

It should be clearer which AppLinks versions are compatible with each other:
 * JIRA 7.4.0 is using AppLinks 5.3.2 while Confluence 5.9.5 is using AppLinks 5.0.4, and in the [Application links version matrix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Application+links+version+matrix] documentation, it is not clear whether 5.3.2 is supposed to be compatible with 5.0.4.

If there is any incompatibility issue, it should be clearly specified in this documentation.
h3. Workaround

It's reported that upgrading Confluence to the latest version may help, but this is not guaranteed as there's also a report that JIRA 7.4.4 shows the same warning connecting to Confluence 6.3.4.

(i) If there's no actual applinks problem, the warning may just be ignored or dismissed.
fields.summary: Application link health check fails with spurious network error

fields.description:
Add a histogram (bar) chart that will show you how many open JIRAs within a given filter have been open for a selection of times (i.e. 0-1 week, 1-3 weeks, 3-6 weeks, 6+weeks).

 y axis = number of jiras

x axis = buckets of time that the filtered jiras fall into 

 This would be helpful to see a summary of all the open JIRAs distributed based on how long a specific parameter such as days open, days since last update, days needed to close JIRAS.

The attached picture hopefully better portray the goal for this chart request.

 The main goal is to be able to at a quick glance determine conclude how your team is doing based on the number of jiras in each "time bucket"

The open jira chart shows that the team has a lot of outstanding issues and only a few new items.

The Time to close / resolve chart shows the history of the approximate amount of time required to close jiras.

 This is different than the "average age" chart because it can separate 1 long term item and 1 short term item. The average age will just average everything and not really provide a clear picture of how many jiras fall into each category.
fields.summary: New Report Gadget for Dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
User can add/inject _JavaScript_  in different places in JIRA, eg: 
* Customfields description
* FieldConfiguration description

That will break UI in very unpredictable way. This is extremely hard to troubleshoot. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to prevent _JavaScript_ from being injected into text fields and make it default.
Only allowed place should be JIRA Admin banner, since it is controlled by JIRA Admin.
 
h3. Workaround 
Review DB manually and check for "_script text/javascript_" text
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to disable all JavaScript in JIRA input except JIRA banner

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 
Current documentation regarding *Schedule a job* is not specific enough about how jobs are scheduled in cluster environment: 
see page: https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/jira-data-center/plugin-guide-to-jira-high-availability-and-clustering 

We need to document current status, see related JRASERVER-65632 

h3. Suggested Solution 
Currently docs mention: 
* Jobs only run once for each scheduled run time. 
* Should only be scheduled by one node in the cluster. 

Please add part covering: 
* There is no guaranty that only one job will be running at specific moment of time across the cluster (Singleton). 
** For example: If job configured as interval job with 1 min interval, Job will scheduled at node1 and than 1 min later at node2, so two instances of the job will be running in the cluster. 
** This should be controlled by job code itself, possibly using *Cluster Locks*. 

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Documentation request: update plugin Guide to JIRA High Availability and Clustering

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+
Attempting to create an application link from JIRA to another application will fail if that application runs over HTTPS with an SSL certificate that uses Subject Alternative Name (SAN). This will also impact existing Application Links, causing them to stop working. This will also impact JIRA gadgets in case of JIRA is behind the proxy with TLS offload as JIRA needs to connect to itself through proxy (see JRASERVER-64137). 

h3. +Environment+
JIRA 7.4.0 bundled with Apache HttpClient 4.5.3.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Configure JIRA and Bamboo to run over HTTPS with an SSL certificate using SAN
 # Ensure Bamboo's certificate has been imported into JIRA's trust store (and vice-versa)
 # From JIRA, create an application link to Bamboo

h3. +Expected behavior+
* The applinks creation is successful on both sides.
* JIRA is able to load gadgets 

h3. +Actual behaviour+
The applinks fails on JIRA side with the following symptoms:
 * Bamboo is not detected and JIRA is asked to provide Consumer key and Shared secret as if Bamboo's SSL cert hadn't been imported. However, there's no PKIX error in the log.
 * Upon the creation completion (just Continue), the following error appears in JIRA GUI:
 !error.png|thumbnail!
 * In JIRA log, the following error is thrown:
{code:java}
2017-07-04 03:54:55,130 https-jsse-nio-8444-exec-11 ERROR username 234x15407x1 fdav2p 109.150.52.183,10.101.200.31 /rest/applinks/3.0/applinks [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: java.lang.ClassCastException: [B cannot be cast to java.lang.String
com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: java.lang.ClassCastException: [B cannot be cast to java.lang.String
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2203)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3937)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.getOrLoad(LocalCache.java:3941)
...
Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: [B cannot be cast to java.lang.String
	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.DefaultHostnameVerifier.getSubjectAltNames(DefaultHostnameVerifier.java:309)
	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.DefaultHostnameVerifier.verify(DefaultHostnameVerifier.java:112)
	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.DefaultHostnameVerifier.verify(DefaultHostnameVerifier.java:99)
	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLConnectionSocketFactory.verifyHostname(SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java:463)
...{code}

h3. +Cause+
JIRA 7.4 uses Apache HttpClient 4.5.3 as can be seen in pom.xml:
{code:java}
<apache.httpclient.version>4.5.3</apache.httpclient.version>
{code}
This version carries this bug that affects SSL certificates with SAN:
 * [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1836]

h3. +Workarounds+
# [Use unproxied applinks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-create-an-unproxied-application-link-719095740.html] that would bypass the SSL check
#* Temporarily use the linked application/s over HTTP (Bamboo as in the context of this report)
# Temporarily use a certificate that doesn't use SAN
#* This could be a problem if you use Chrome 58+

h3. Note on fix 
httpclient version was upgraded to 4.5.4: pom.xml
{code:borderStyle=solid}
-        <apache.httpclient.version>4.5.3</apache.httpclient.version>
+        <apache.httpclient.version>4.5.4</apache.httpclient.version>
{code}

h3. +Note+
* This may cause a JIRA's Base URL healthcheck problem which in turn leads to the following problem:
** [Error when logging in or visiting dashboards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Error+when+logging+in+or+visiting+dashboards]
* Also note that Chromium/Chrome removed support for matching common name (CN) in certificates in M58, so enforcing users to switch to SAN, so that makes bug more critical. 
** https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=308330
fields.summary: JIRA applinks fail if SSL certificate uses Subject Alternative Name (SAN)

fields.description:
# Create 2 projects in JIRA, project A  and project B .

Expected output:
mandatory filed should be available in move wizard screen 

Actual output:
mandatory field is not available in move wizard screen and issue can be move without any problem

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a user shares a filter to 'Any logged-in user,' the permissions reflect simply 'Project:' in the Details screen. 

!image-2017-07-10-17-36-05-684.png!
h3. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
h3. !image-2017-07-10-17-35-47-086.png!
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be more intuitive if the the Details page reflected 'Any logged-in user' 
h3. Why this is important

The current way that it works is difficult for new users to quickly assess that the filter they just shared is, in fact, shared.  An admin must explain this to the end user, which wastes valuable time.  It does not seem reasonable that the Details page should reflect something completely different than the option that the user selected.
fields.summary: More intuitive labeling of permissions in Details screen of filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Since 7.4.0, a duplicate 'javax.inject' package has been introduced in the JIRA installation folder, and we get the following warning in the JIRA logs:
{code:java}
2017-06-30 10:38:54,371 JIRA-Bootstrap WARN      [o.twdata.pkgscanner.ExportPackageListBuilder] Package Scanner found duplicates for package 'javax.inject' with different versions. Files: org.apache.servicemix.bundles.javax-inject-1_2.jar and javax.inject-1.jar
      '<JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/org.apache.servicemix.bundles.javax-inject-1_2.jar'
      '<JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/javax.inject-1.jar'
{code}
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.4.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Go to the folder <JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib
 - Look for any file name that contains the string "javax.inject"

h3. Expected Results

There should be only one file (like it was the case in previous versions of JIRA).
h3. Actual Results

2 files are found:
 - org.apache.servicemix.bundles.javax-inject-1_2.jar
 - javax.inject-1.jar
fields.summary: Duplicate package 'javax.inject' in JIRA installation folder

fields.description:
Currently Project Administrators can edit workflows and screens only when they are *exclusive* for particular project.

It would be great to extend these capabilities for projects *sharing* some configuration, but still configuration to be *exclusive* for given group of projects.
fields.summary: Allow Project Administrators to edit reused entities

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if an issue is created via email and end user included any content that matches wiki markup, the content is automatically rendered in wiki markup styles.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature to turn off wiki renderer for issue created via email.

h3. Why this is important
When we use email channel for an external user to create an issue in JIRA, the external user won't have any idea about wiki markup that is available in JIRA hence the original context of the issue raised by customer will be interpreted different in JIRA which can leads to confusion at external as well as internal JIRA users.
 
h3. Workaround 
+Disable Wiki Render For Description Field+
# Go to project settings of the affected project.
# Click on *Field*
# Click the edit button on field configuration scheme for the project.
# Locate description field
# Change the renderer from *wiki style renderer* to *text renderer* by clicking on the *renderer* button on the right of the description field.

(i) Note that this option will disable all the renderer option for this description field. Hence the most convenient way would be option 1. Do test it out and let us know how it goes.
fields.summary: Ability To Turn Off Wiki Renderer For Issue Created Via Email

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Editing the description field via Field Configurations page breaks the description on the Custom field page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a custom field ABC and add description, let's use ORIGINAL
2. Assign it on the Default Screen
3. Go to the Default field configuration and you'll see the description value is ORIGINAL
4. Navigate to Custom fields page and modify the description value to MODIFIED
5. On the Default field configuration page, it shows MODIFIED as well
6. This time, edit the description value via Default Field Configuration for the same field to MODIFIED TWICE

h3. Expected Behaviour
The description on the Custom fields page should be MODIFIED TWICE

h3. Actual Behaviour
It stays to MODIFIED and didn't synced up to what has been modified via Field Configurations page


h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Editing the CF description via Field Configuration page breaks the Description field value

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With the release of JIRA 7.4, a new page called "Johnson screen" was introduced to inform the admin user of any health check that has failed during the upgrade, such as:
 - database connection failure
 - incompatible database collation issue
 - database driver not found

One test that is missing is the database version compatibility.

We faced a situation where a customer tried to upgrade from JIRA 7.2.x to 7.4.0 with an incompatible database (Microsoft SQL Server - 10.50.6220), and during the upgrade, one of the upgrade task failed with the following error:
{code:java}
2017-07-03 17:27:10,425 Caesium-1-2 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.upgrade.core.DefaultUpgradeTaskFactoryProcessor] Upgrade task [host,buildNumber=73011] failed
com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught SQLException for select ISSUE.workflow_id
from jiraschema.jiraissue ISSUE
left join jiraschema.OS_CURRENTSTEP O_S_CURRENT_STEP
on O_S_CURRENT_STEP.ENTRY_ID = ISSUE.workflow_id
where O_S_CURRENT_STEP.ID is null and ISSUE.workflow_id > ?
order by ISSUE.workflow_id asc
offset ? rows fetch next ? rows only
	at com.querydsl.sql.support.JavaSE7SQLExceptionWrapper.wrap(JavaSE7SQLExceptionWrapper.java:41)
	at com.querydsl.sql.DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.java:48)
	at com.querydsl.sql.Configuration.translate(Configuration.java:453)
	at com.querydsl.sql.AbstractSQLQuery.fetch(AbstractSQLQuery.java:502)
{code}
From the JIRA UI point of view, it looked like the customer upgraded successfully to JIRA 7.4.0, but in reality, some of the features were missing such as the Kanban backlog. If the database version issue had been caught by the upgrade health check and displayed on the Johnson screen, the customer would have been informed that the upgrade didn't complete properly due to the database incompatibility issue.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the database version to the upgrade health check, and inform the user via the Johnson screen when their database is incompatible with JIRA.
h3. Why this is important

Adding the database version check is important, so that the customer was be informed that something went wrong during the ugprade, and that they need to change their database to a supported version.
fields.summary: Johnson screen improvement: Extend the upgrade check list to include database version compatibility

fields.description: In JIRA Cloud there are 56 modules in the JIRA Workflow add-on, but there are only 21 modules for the same add-on in JIRA Server. JIRA Server should be updated to include the additional modules found in JIRA Cloud.
fields.summary: Expand JIRA Server Workflow Modules to Match Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no official documentation on how the resolution date is updated in JIRA is it based on workflow status or resolution field as sometimes some other status such as *in progress* can have their own resolution field value such as *incomplete*, this causes any reporting done based on resolution date to be inaccurate as from end user perspective resolution date should follow a workflow status instead of resolution field.

h3. Suggested Solution
An official documentation on how Resolved, Resolution and Resolution Date in JIRA would be helpful to clear the confusion for the end user.
fields.summary: Documentation On Explaining The Behavior of Resolved, Resolution and Resolution Date

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

A JIRA issue can be linked to multiple Confluence pages, in which case the remotelinks table in the JIRA database will look like:
{code:java}
id | issueid | globalid | (Other columns) 
-------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------
10006 | 10000 | applink=777f0fe1-eb88-3927-a8af-984ec2cb8192&spaceKey=ds&key=PREQ-011&issue=TEST-1&relationship=resolves | ...
10007 | 10000 | applink=777f0fe1-eb88-3927-a8af-984ec2cb8192&spaceKey=ds&key=PREQ-012&issue=TEST-1&relationship=resolves | ...{code}
(i) The same JIRA issue (10000) is linked with 2 different Confluence pages (PREQ-011 and PREQ-012).

When this happens, calling findRemoteIssueLinksByGlobalId will throw IllegalArgumentException:
{code:java}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Multiple entries with same key: 10000=TEST-1 and 10000=TEST-1
{code}
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Link JIRA with Confluence via applinks
 # Link a JIRA issue with at least 2 Confluence pages
 # Use Java API to call findRemoteIssueLinksByGlobalId 

h3. +Expected behavior+

The method is executed successfully and issue links are returned.
h3. +Actual Behavior+

JIRA throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Multiple entries with same key.
h3. +Workaround+

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: findRemoteIssueLinksByGlobalId throws IllegalArgumentException if an issue has multiple valid global IDs

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

!/images/icons/emoticons/forbidden.png!  Currently, only fields on Default tab can be updated without using setSkipScreenCheck. setSkipScreenCheck must be used to update fields on non-default tabs.

This contradicts [setSkipScreenCheck|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.3.0/com/atlassian/jira/issue/IssueInputParameters.html#setSkipScreenCheck-boolean-]:
{quote}By default, the Issue Service only allows setting values to fields which appear on the screen of the operation which you are performing (e.g. the Edit screen). By enabling this flag, the Issue Service will skip this check.
{quote}
which means:
 * We don't need to use setSkipScreenCheck to set values to fields on screen, no matter which screen tabs they're on.
 * We only need to use setSkipScreenCheck to set values to fields that are not on the screen (not on any screen tab).

h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Add fieldA and fieldB to the Default tab of a screen and use that screen in an Issue Operation e.g. Edit Issue
 # Use Java API to edit an issue that uses the screen, updating the values of fieldA and fieldB
 # Edit the screen and add a new tab, then move fieldB to that tab (fieldA remains in Default tab)
 # Repeat step 2

h3. +Expected behavior+

In both steps 2 and 4 above, both fieldA and fieldB are updated correctly.
h3. +Actual Behavior+
 * At step 2, both fields are updated.
 * At step 4, only fieldA which is on the Default tab is updated. fieldB is not updated (because it's on a non-default tab).

h3. +Workaround+

At step 4, calling issueInputParameters.setSkipScreenCheck(true) before updating fieldB's value.
fields.summary: setSkipScreenCheck is required to update fields on non-default tabs

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
Adding a comment to an issue from the issue navigator, in 'List View' mode, it triggers duplicated notification/message.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform any search in the issue navigator
# Switch to List View
# Use the "..." option on the right side of the screen and select "Comment" ([^doublemessage01.png]).
# Add any comment ([^doublemessage02.png]).

h5. Expected Behavior
* The message is added and JIRA shows a incoming message at the top right corner indicating the user that the issue was updated.

h5. Actual Behavior
* The message is added but JIRA shows a _duplicated_ incoming message at the top right corner indicating the user that the issue was updated ([^doublemessage03.png]).

h5. Cause
* Unknown.

h5. Workaround
* None.

h5. Notes:
* Browser independent (tested in Chrome 59, Firefox 52 and MS Edge 40 [^MSEdge_doublemessage.png]).
* Seems to be independent from Notification scheme, as this was tested with diferent combinations of being/not being the assignee, being/not being the reporter and being/not being a Watcher.
fields.summary: Adding a comment to an issue from the List View triggers duplicated notification/message

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Duplicate issues are created when the mail handler has to process a mailbox with a large number of emails or a small number of emails with large attachments as the caesium threads get stuck processing emails.

Although there is not exact figure to define  "a large number of emails" in an attempt to provide a guideline for future issues that can be diagnose as this bug what it was found is that the mailbox has to have more 500 emails to be processed and it was also observed that when the first job processing emails reached approximately the 200th is when duplicates issues start appearing in the system.

It is also important to note that the same problem can happen when the mail handler has to process large amounts of data rather than a large number of emails, for example a few emails with big attachments (files larger than 8 or 10 MB),  as the problem is related to the fact that if the running job on one node (job-A on node-1)takes longer than the time that the next job of the same type (job-B) is scheduled to run and it is scheduled to run on a different node than node-1 (for example node-2) then we will see both jobs (job-A and job-B) running at the same time on two different nodes (node-A and node-B).

To summarize, the problem is that the scheduler ensures that a clustered job will not run on the same node that is already running but will not check the same for other nodes in the JIRA DC cluster.

\\
h2. Environment

* JIRA Data Center 7.2.9 with two or mode nodes active in the cluster.
* Jira standard mail handler configured
* POP or IMAP mail box

\\
h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Create or find a POP or IMAP mailbox with either more than 25 emails having big files attached to them or more than 500 emails without attachments. (Please see the Additional notes section below)
# Install JIRA Data Center 7.2.9 and start up two nodes
# Go to the Incoming Mail screen (<IP>:<PORT>/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa)
# Add and configure one mail server (it does not matter if it is a pop or imap)
# Add an incoming mail handler
# Configure the incoming mail handler as follows:
## Specify a name
## Select the mail server previously created
## Delay --> 1
## Handler --> Create a new issue from each email message
## Project --> choose a project name
## Default Reporter --> choose the user that will be the reporter of the created issues
## Leave all other fields not mentioned above as per the respective default settings
## Click on Save
# Wait until the mail handler starts connecting to the mail box and starts processing email.
# Monitor the issues being created

\\
h2. Expected Results

It is expected that only one issue per email processed is created in the respective project.

\\
h2. Actual Results

Duplicate issues are created when having two nodes in the JIRA Data Center cluster.

h2. Note
Problem caused by 2 factors: 
* JIRA Datacenter scheduler doesn't guaranty that only one job will be running at specific moment of time across the cluster (Singleton).  See: JRASERVER-65599 
* There is no cluster lock for _Mail Handler_. 

h2. Workaround

It is less likely to reproduce the issue when the "Delay" parameter (in the incoming mail handler configuration) has a higher value than 1 minute, however that also depends on how much data needs to be processed and hence in some cases increasing it to 3 minutes can workaround the issue whereas in others it has to be 5 minutes or higher.

*Set the "Delay" parameter to a higher value than 1 minute (keep increasing it if you still see duplicates) and monitor the system until no duplicates are created.*
fields.summary: JIRA creates duplicate issues when the standard mail handler has to process a large number of emails or large amounts of data..

fields.description:
h2. Summary
JIRA is throwing a NullPointerException when we attempt to hide the "com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:browse-project-activity-stream" element. This, in turn, is causing the activity stream to be disabled on ALL projects. 
The NPE is as follows:
{code}Unable to run plugin code because of 'java.lang.NullPointerException - Cannot invoke method getContextParams() on null object'{code}
We initially suspected an issue on our end, however, I tracked down this exception to a method that is passed a JiraHelper object. It would appear that, within the context of the aforementioned element, that JiraHelper object is null. Because of this, a NPE is thrown when a call is made to the method getContextParams().

To add some context, this is in a class that extends the com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.conditions.AbstractWebCondition class. We're using it in our plugin (ScriptRunner) to determine whether some web items should display in the UI.
It looks like the jiraHelper that's getting passed to the method is null, but only when the item we're trying to hide is the "com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:browse-project-activity-stream" item. There may be other affected items, but that's where the NPE crops up.

h2. Environment
*JIRA-Core: 7.3.8 | JIRA-Software: 7.3.8
*ScriptRunner: 5.0.11

h2. Steps To Reproduce
The simplest way to reproduce the error is to install ScriptRunner and configure a Hide UI Element Script Fragment that hides the com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:browse-project-activity-stream web item. For the condition field, you can just type 'true'. That should reproduce the error when you visit the project summary page ($baseUrl/projects/KEY/summary).

However, we are working on creating a simple plugin that doesn't rely on ScriptRunner as a method of reproduction.

h2. Expected Results
"com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:browse-project-activity-stream" element is hidden only when the condition evaluates to "false."

h3. Actual Results
Element is hidden all of the time, and a NPE is thrown in the logs:
{code}Unable to run plugin code because of 'java.lang.NullPointerException - Cannot invoke method getContextParams() on null object'{code}
fields.summary: JIRA is throwing a NullPointerException when we attempt to hide the "com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:browse-project-activity-stream" element

h3. Summary
When *Display the Trend of Unresolved* option in *Created vs. Resolved Chart* gadget is turned on, JIRA fails to render the unresolved trend chart and there is also a display issue for the original Created vs. Resolved Chart which could be a side effect of the problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.4.0 and add a *Created vs. Resolved Chart* gadget to the dashboard.
# Set *Display the Trend of Unresolved* to Yes and save the settings.

h3. Expected Results
 !2017-07-06_gadget-ok.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !2017-07-06_gadget-ko.png|thumbnail! 

Follow JS errors are thrown in the browser console :
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: d.layerable is not a function
    at e.render (batch.js:1880)
    at p._renderChart (batch.js:1913)
    at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js:1913)
    at j (batch.js:60)
    at Object.fireWith [as resolveWith] (batch.js:61)
    at d (batch.js:186)
    at XMLHttpRequest.b (batch.js:198)
{code}

h3.NOTE:
Additional Rendering issue occurs on page refresh when "Display the Trend of Unresolved" is set to Yes, the Gadget is collapsed making it not visible until the gadget is edited and saved again (No Changes necessary):

No workaround at the moment except for turning the *Display the Trend of Unresolved* option off.

fields.description:
Business Case for Suggestion:

We constantly have "clutter" comments being added to comments inside a JIRA Issue.  

This is often the automated posting/reposting of full email threads of a case when the case is initiated by a customer forwarding a long email of case history, manual internal posting of an entire thread to show the context of a request, etc.  This makes it very frustrating to locate "real" comments and leads to having to scroll through literally hundreds of lines of content to get to the "add comment" button that is located at the bottom of all the comments.

 

Suggestion:

Allow a parameter to limit the initial view of the content of all comment to X characters (e.g. 200 characters) before putting a "Click to view more" expand button.  In addition to that, add an "expand all" option for the comments tab to ensure that anyone who wants to use a "find" option inside a browser could quickly expand all comments to locate a key-word within longer comments.  

 

Hopefully, this is a simplified approach from previous request for user-driven, macro-based expandable comment content: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33995
fields.summary: Automatically limit comment content to X characters (with Expand option) to improve readability of comments

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce the issue: 
# Install Confluence and JIRA, create the application link by using OAuth with Impersonation.
# Config the "Assigned to me" gadget on Confluence and create a page with the gadget. 

h3. Expected behavior 
When configuring the gadget, it should show the same as the gadget on JIRA without authentication request. 

h3. Actual behaviour
When configuring the gadget, the "Login & Approve" window popup which requires an authentication against JIRA before we can continue the configuration. 

h3. Business impact
Since the trusted app is deprecated since Application link 5.2 and the actual Oauth system require one token per gadget per user, the user has to go through all gadget to generate the token to grant the access. This is having a huge user experience impact with the instance having 1k+ users as the feedback shared in the ticket https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-45189
fields.summary: JIRA gadget did not use the Oauth impersonation protocol

fields.description:
h2. Summary: 

When you manually modified the Description field for a custom field's translation, it will break other language's description. 

h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field, fill up the name (Atlassian) and Description (Atlassian Desc).
 # After the custom field has been created, assign it to a screen.
 # Perform a reindex.
 # Back to the Custom fields page, click on the cogwheel beside the custom field that you just created and click on Translate.
 # Create a Translation for English US, German and French, filling up the Field Name and Description
 ** US Atlassian-US, US desc
 ** German Atlassian-German, German desc
 ** French Atlassian-French, French desc
 # Go to your Profile and change the language preference to German
 # To verify whether the translation works, go to the Field Configurations page and look for Atlassian. You should see Atlassian-German as the field name and German desc on the description. This also works on the screens where you have assigned this custom field to.
 # In the Field Configurations page, click on the Edit link beside Atlassian-German and modify the translated description. This seems to work fine on the screens where you have assigned this custom field to.
 # The problem now is, when you change the language preference in your Profile to any other languages, the description for Atlassian custom field seem to get stuck on the modified German description.

h2. Expected Behaviour

Changing language preference should show the translated ones for available translations while for languages without translation, it uses the field name and description defined on the custom field page

h2. Actual Behaviour

The description seems to get stuck to the modified description even you change it to other languages.

h2. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Manually Modifying the translated Custom Field Description breaks Other Language's Description

h5. Issue Summary

A number of Language Packs like Polish, Dutch, Italian, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Czech, Estonian, Hungarian, Slovak, Romanian, Icelandic from https://translations.atlassian.com/ are unavailable for download, showing the message:
{code}This language pack is now bundled with Atlassian products, so is no longer available to download here.To get this language pack, upgrade to the latest version of your product.{code}
See image [^downloaddisabled.png]

h5. Expected behavior
After installing the JIRA 7.4 Core, JIRA 7.4 Software or JIRA 3.6 (all latest versions), these languages are part of the bundle or are available for download from the Atlassian Marketplace.

h5. Actual behavior
After installing the JIRA 7.4 Core, JIRA 7.4 Software or JIRA 3.6 (all latest versions), these languages are not bundled, and are not available for download from the Atlassian Marketplace (see images [^jirasdbundledlanguages.png], [^jiracore740.png], [^jira74languages.png])

h5. Affected Versions
* JIRA 7.4 Core
* JIRA 7.4 Software
* JIRA SD 3.6.0

h5. Notes
* If you look in the Atlassian  Marketplace , you only get 2 language packs, Polish which is an old and unsupported version, and Arabic, which is an already existent third-party add-on (see [^sd36marketplace.png]).

h2. Expected Behaviour

...
upgrade.reindex.allowed                       : false
...
2017-07-05 14:19:33,476 Caesium-1-4 INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.UpgradeIndexManager] Reindexing is not allowed after this upgrade and there is no immediate reindex requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When linking a JIRA Issue to a remote link, such as a Confluence page, the JIRA issue is not reindexed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Re-index JIRA, ensuring that the Health Check shows the Lucene Index is healthy
 # Add debug logging on {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.index }}
 # Insert a JIRA issues macro onto a new Confluence page (ensure that this is the first time that issue has been linked to that page)
 # Refresh the support tools screen - the index shows as unhealthy.
 ** The database has received an update from Confluence, but has not been reflected in the index
 # Edit the issue that you linked, and it will be reindexed. Checking the support tools screen shows the lucene index is healthy again

h3. Additional Diagnostic Information

Debug logging shows the following when an issue is edited and subsequently indexed:
{code:java}
2017-07-05 10:55:53,554 http-nio-9733-exec-25 DEBUG admin 655x693x1 bmvmt3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer] Performing an index operation: All issues provided by iterable will be specifically reloaded from the database before indexing
2017-07-05 10:55:53,557 http-nio-9733-exec-25 DEBUG admin 655x693x1 bmvmt3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory] Indexing issue: TEST-11
2017-07-05 10:55:53,575 http-nio-9733-exec-25 DEBUG admin 655x693x1 bmvmt3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Reindexed 1 issues in 21ms.
{code}
This debug logging does not appear for issues that have only been touched when updated via a remotelink. This behaviour can also be verified, by using Adaptavist ScriptRunner, which queries via the index:

ScriptRunner can be used to validate the problem. Use the following JQL:
{code:java}
issueFunction in linkedIssuesOfRemote("query", "pageId=xxx"){code}
In this JQL, {{xxx}} is a page ID in Confluence. It will show all the issues that have a remote link back to that page ID - but if the issue has not been updated in the index, it cannot be found via this function (or other index based functions).

Issue Linking from Confluence can lead to issues where the database is up to date, but the Lucene index is not up to date, which makes searching and reporting on issues in JIRA unreliable. This will also affect *all* JQL queries based on the index - even viewing issues in issue navigator, ordered by updated date shows the issue hasn't been touched recently, when it actually has.

This also occurs when you link an issue to a Confluence page from inside JIRA - the index is not updated in the same fashion. 
h3. Expected Results

The issue is reindexed, as if it has been updated manually.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is not reindexed, and the Lucene Health Check fails 
h3. Workaround

Touch the issue to perform a reindex, or reindex JIRA.
fields.summary: Remote Linking of Issues doesn't reindex issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when a JIRA user has "Administer Projects" permission, but does not have "Browse Project" permission, if this user goes to a JIRA Software Project Setting page, and clicks on "Versions" from the left navigation bar, the following error is displayed:
 "The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.", as shown in the screenshot below:
 !ErrorWhenClickingVersions.png|thumbnail! 

If we analyze the web requests from the HAR file, we see that there is a GET request going to a link containing "projects/1.0/project/undefined/release/allversions", that returns returns the not found (404) message.

If we put this link into a browser, we get the following error:
{code:java}
["No project could be found with key 'undefined'."]
{code}
Instead of giving an error 404, JIRA should provide a message on the screen saying that the user can't access the "Versions" link because this user doesn't have the "Browse Project" permission.

Currently, the way it is working is not intuitive, because we would think that as a Project Administrator, we should be able to access "Versions", since it's part of the Project Administration menu, but it is not possible without the "Browse Project" permission.
h3. Suggested Solution

2 suggestions:
 - Either let the user with Project Administrator permission access "Versions"
 - Or, if a user without "Browse Project" permission tries to access "Versions", display a message on the screen explaining why this user can't access this page.

h3. Why this is important

I think that this feature request is important because at the moment the way JIRA is designed is not intuitive and can be confusing for the Project Administrator.
h3. Workaround

Grant the user with "Browse Project" permission, and the user will be able to access "Versions".
fields.summary: Display a message on a screen when a user without "Browse project" permission tries to access "Versions" from a Project Administration page

h3. Workaround

fields.summary: Provide SHA256 for all files available from Atlassian

fields.description:
The typical business logic for voting on an issue (as presented in the JIRA UI) is that a user cannot vote for an issue that they are the reporter of.

However, the Issue Actions REST endpoint (as used by JIRA's Activity Stream) allows a user to vote for an issue they are the reporter of.

This is a bug in the sense that it is inconsistent behaviour as presented by the JIRA UI -- the view issue page versus the activity stream.

It should be noted that there's a pretty simple workaround for people desperate to vote on their own issues, though: change the issue reporter to someone else, vote on it, then change the reporter back. Since the workaround of this business rule is so simple, the severity of this bug cannot be any higher than trivial.
fields.summary: A user can vote for their own issue via the inline issue actions REST endpoint

However, only *prefix searching* is available and *partial searching* is not supported.

h3. Suggested Solution

When it comes to some enterprise use cases, email addresses tend to be like,

* firstname.surname@example.com
* firstname_surname@example.com
* firstname-surname@example.com

It would be nice if we could do partial searching with using keywords which are separated by some special characters like ".", "_", "-". (Especially in the above examples, we want to search users with *surname*.)
fields.summary: Partial searching with using email address in user picker fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If users search for *worklogDate = -1d* parameter on Monday for example, JIRA will display result from Sunday instead for the day of the last working day.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add function in JIRA so the worklogDate parameter will respect the Working Days set in JIRA and when user search with worklogDate parameter, JIRA display result from the previous working day.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Improve worklogDate parameter to respect working days

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Using the JQL like following:

{code:java}
worklogDate = -1d AND worklogAuthor in (username) ORDER BY updatedDate ASC
{code}

Will result in JIRA showing the total timespent in the issue still yesterday. Customer would like the ability to show the time spent only for the day set in the JQL. Eg, if the *worklogDate = -1d*, JIRA should only show the timespent for yesterday and not the total amount of timespent till yesterday.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add a new operator or parameter that allows user to search timespent for specific day.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Allow worklogDate to show result of timespent for specific day only

fields.description: Imagine a feature that has 20 user stories. Imagine having to do work in several user stories. Because JIRA now only shows a few links by default, you open the links list, work on a user story, and then the list collapses. Open the links again, work on a user story, collapses again. Time consuming and irritating. When working in a feature the links should just stay open after the user opens them until the user leaves the page.
fields.summary: Collapsing links makes working in features with multiple user stories tedious

fields.description: Greatly dislike the way JIRA is now hiding all but the most recent comments. This means people cannot search on a phrase to find info they need in comments. It causes confusion because people don't always realize comments are hidden, and conversations go in circles. Please allow users to choose whether to hide comments or not instead of making this decision for them.
fields.summary: Hiding comments by default hides important info and creates confusion

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When installing JIRA 7.4.x to directories with similar names, it gives you a false positive stating that:

{code}Configured jira.home '<jira-home>' must not be a parent directory of the webapp servlet path '<jira-install>'{code}


h3. Steps to Reproduce

Install a new copy of JIRA 7.4.x, using:

*<jira-home>* = /test/test
*<jira-install>* = /test/test-installdir

h3. Expected Results

JIRA launches without issue, as it does in <7.3.x.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA fails to start, with the error:

{code}
Setup: Your jira.home path is a parent of your webapp servlet path
Your jira.home path /test/test can't be the parent directory your webapp servlet path /test/test-installdir/atlassian-jira.

Review our documentation for more information on setting your JIRA home.
{code}

h5. Workaround

Use a different home/installation directory layout with more distinct names in JIRA 7.4.x.
fields.summary: False Positive On Directory Layout On Install/Upgrade
